intro: Codonoboea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually small, clustered in umbels, and come in shades of white, pink, or purple. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
